meanings.definition: A person or animal that is sleeping.
meanings.sent1: The sleepers in the house were all snoring peacefully.
meanings.sent2: I always check on my pet sleepers before going to bed.
meanings.sent3: The sleepers in the zoo looked so cozy in their beds.
meanings.sent4: The sleepers in the barn were as still as statues.
meanings.sent5: The sleepers under the tree were dreaming of chasing butterflies.

meanings.definition: A railroad tie that is laid horizontally under the rails to support them.
meanings.sent1: The workers replaced the old sleepers with new ones on the train tracks.
meanings.sent2: The train rolled smoothly over the sturdy sleepers beneath the rails.
meanings.sent3: The sleepers on the train track seemed to be taking a nap under the passing trains.
meanings.sent4: The sleepers held the railway tracks together like a strong foundation.
meanings.sent5: The sleepers supported the weight of the train with ease.

meanings.definition: A spy or terrorist who remains inactive in a target country until activated.
meanings.sent1: The government was concerned about the presence of sleeper agents in the country.
meanings.sent2: The sleeper was waiting for the signal to carry out the mission.
meanings.sent3: The sleeper spy blended in so well that no one suspected their true identity.
meanings.sent4: The sleeper cell was like a hidden time bomb waiting to be triggered.
meanings.sent5: The sleeper operative was trained to act normal until called into action.
